constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 16 (Tuesday, January 25, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. GIBBS:
H.R. 6486.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8, Clause 18, that grants Congress the
power to make all laws necessary and proper for carrying out
the powers vested by Congress in the Constitution of the
United States or in any department or officer thereof.
[Page H302]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.

title: Transparency in Government Officials Trading Act
